comments.body: Something that I regularly do (and find valuable, also for afterwards writing simple tests), is further simplifying the example. Even if reporters provide a reproducible case, it can often be simplified a lot.

comments.body: At some point, I think it would also be useful to have a more in-depth guide for reviewing pull requests (but not for this PR :))

Reviewing Pull Requests
-----------------------

Anybody can review a pull request: regular contributors, triagers, or core-team

comments.body:
If we are going to list what it means to be a maintainer / core team member, there is IMO missing one: think about API design or organisational issues, provide input on discussions, .. 

That might overlap with the line above, but I find it a bit narrow (it's not only relevant for stalled issues, although in those case the "final call" should probably come from maintainers)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +33,37 @@* Review newly opened pull requests
* Respond to updates on existing issues and pull requests
* Drive discussion and decisions on stalled issues and pull requests
* Provide experience / wisdom on API design questions to ensure consistency and maintainability
* Project organization (run / attend developer meetings, represent pandas)

comments.body: In general (certainly if it's like a merge conflict or a small remaining lint error or typo fix), we should do this more often IMO instead of closing PRs that are in such a "final" state.
